descr.p: "Little Things Mean a Lot" is a popular song written by Edith Lindeman and Carl Stutz, published in 1953. Lindeman was the leisure editor of the Richmond Times-Despatchand Stutz a disc jockey from Richmond, Virginia.

The best known recording of the song, by Kitty Kallen, reached #1 on the U.S. Billboard chart in 1954 and also reached #1 on the Cash Box chart the same year. In addition the track climbed to the top spot in the UK Singles Chart in September that year.

A cover of the song was done by Alma Cogan in the United Kingdom in the same year. Cogan's recording was released by HMV as catalog number HMV B 10717 and reached number 11 on the UK chart. The flip side was "Canoodlin' Rag". A remake by Joni James hit the U.S. Top 40 in 1960.

Singer Joni James revived the song in 1960, a top 40 record. Another version of the song was done by country singer Margo Smith in 1978. The song peaked at #3 on the U.S. country chart that year, also appearing in Billboard's Easy Listening Top 50.
For Kallen her UK hit making days were over almost before they had begun. Without any further chart presence there, she became the first of the UK one-hit wonders.
